facts: The SEAT Leon ST is a compact estate (station wagon) version of the SEAT Leon hatchback
The ST designation stands for 'Sports Tourer'
The first SEAT Leon ST was introduced in 2013 as part of the third generation (Type 5F) Leon lineup
The SEAT Leon ST was produced from 2013 to 2020 in its third generation
The SEAT Leon is built on Volkswagen Group's MQB platform
The MQB platform is shared with the Volkswagen Golf, Audi A3, and Skoda Octavia
The 2023 SEAT Leon ST with 150hp features a 1.5 TSI engine
The 1.5 TSI engine is a four-cylinder turbocharged petrol unit
The 1.5 TSI 150hp engine produces 110 kW (150 PS/148 hp)
The engine displacement is 1,498 cc
The maximum torque of the 1.5 TSI 150hp engine is 250 Nm
The SEAT Leon ST 1.5 TSI 150 has a combined fuel consumption of 5.5-6.3 L/100km according to WLTP
This translates to approximately 37.3-42.8 mpg (US) or 44.8-51.4 mpg (UK)
The CO2 emissions range from 125 to 143 g/km depending on specification
Real-world fuel consumption reported by owners ranges from 34 to 52 mpg
Highway fuel consumption at 130 km/h is approximately 6.9 L/100km
The boot capacity of the SEAT Leon ST is 620 litres with rear seats up
With rear seats folded down, the boot capacity extends to 1,620 litres
The plug-in hybrid (e-HYBRID) version has a reduced boot capacity of 470 litres due to the battery pack
The SEAT Leon ST boot capacity is 30 litres larger than its predecessor
The boot is larger than the Ford Focus Estate (575 litres) and Toyota Corolla Touring Sports
The Skoda Octavia Estate offers 20 litres more boot space than the Leon ST
The overall length of the SEAT Leon ST is 4,642 mm (182.8 inches)
The width without mirrors is 1,799 mm (70.8 inches)
The width with mirrors is 1,975 mm
The height is 1,450 mm (57.1 inches)
The SEAT Leon ST has a wheelbase of approximately 2,686 mm
The curb weight starts from approximately 1,233 kg depending on specification
The gross vehicle weight is up to 1,800 kg
The SEAT Leon received a 5-star Euro NCAP safety rating
Adult occupant protection score: 88%
Child occupant protection score: 86%
Vulnerable road users protection score: 81%
Safety assist score: 77%
The Leon ST features Autonomous Emergency Braking (AEB) as standard
Side Assist (blind spot monitoring) is available
Exit Assist warns occupants of approaching traffic when opening doors
The vehicle includes a driver monitoring system using steering inputs
Lane Assist helps keep the vehicle in its lane
Traffic Sign Recognition is available
Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) is offered on higher trims
The Leon ST received two Euro NCAP Advanced awards for safety technology
Multi-collision brake assist is standard across the range
Front and rear seatbelt reminders are included
The Leon ST features full LED headlights on FR and higher trims
Matrix LED headlights with dynamic turn signals are available
LED daytime running lights are standard on all models
The infotainment system ranges from 8.25 inches to 12.9 inches depending on trim
A 10-inch touchscreen is standard on most models
The Media System Plus features wireless smartphone charging (15W)
Full Link technology includes wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto
The Digital Cockpit features a 10.25-inch TFT LCD display
The Digital Cockpit is fully customizable
SEAT Connect app allows remote vehicle access
The vehicle features a built-in eSIM for connectivity
Car2X connectivity allows vehicle-to-vehicle communication
Voice control and natural language recognition are available
Amazon Alexa integration is offered
The Leon ST is the first 100% connected vehicle in SEAT's history
Real-time traffic information is provided through the navigation system
Over-the-air updates are supported for software improvements
Available trim levels include SE, SE Dynamic, Style, FR, FR Sport, and Xcellence
FR models feature sports suspension as standard
Dynamic Chassis Control (DCC) is available as an option
DCC offers three modes: Comfort, Normal, and Sport
Progressive steering reduces effort when parking while improving highway stability
17-inch alloy wheels are standard on SE Dynamic trim
18-inch alloy wheels are available on FR and higher trims
The FR Sport features 18-inch Performance alloy wheels
Sports seats with enhanced lateral support are standard on FR models
Heated front seats are available on higher trim levels
Dual-zone climate control is standard on most trims
Ambient lighting with multiple color options is available
The vehicle features tinted rear windows on higher specifications
Electric folding door mirrors are standard
Auto-dimming rearview mirror is included in the convenience pack
Rain-sensing wipers and automatic headlights are available
Keyless entry and push-button start are offered
A panoramic sunroof is available as an option
Rear parking sensors are standard on most trims
A rearview camera is included on higher specifications
Front parking sensors are available
Park Assist can automatically steer the vehicle into parking spaces
The Leon ST offers seating for five passengers
ISOFIX child seat anchors are provided in the rear seats
The Leon ST celebrates 25 years of the Leon nameplate (launched in 1999)
The fourth generation Leon features MQB Evo platform
SEAT is a Spanish automobile manufacturer based in Martorell, near Barcelona
SEAT is part of the Volkswagen Group
The Leon competes with the Volkswagen Golf Estate, Ford Focus Estate, and Skoda Octavia
The Leon ST is considered to be sharper to drive than the VW Golf Estate
Engine options include TSI (petrol), TDI (diesel), eTSI (mild hybrid), and e-HYBRID (plug-in hybrid)
The 2.0 TDI diesel engine offers fuel economy up to 58.3 mpg
Seven-speed DSG automatic transmission is available
Six-speed manual transmission is also offered
The mild hybrid (eTSI) system uses 48V technology
The e-HYBRID plug-in hybrid combines a petrol engine with an electric motor
Total powertrain options range from 115 PS (85 kW) to 204 PS (150 kW)
The 1.5 TSI engine features cylinder deactivation (ACT) technology
Average repair costs for SEAT Leon are approximately £800
Full service costs around £193 in the UK
Interim service costs approximately £139 in the UK
SEAT parts are comparatively affordable compared to premium brands
The Leon ST has above-average scores for wear rates on brakes and wiper blades
Common issues include engine and gearbox repairs (averaging over £1,300)
Water pumps and camshafts should be replaced every 60,000 miles
The 1.5 TSI engine is considered one of the most reliable modern direct injection engines
SEAT offers a standard 3-year or 60,000-mile warranty (whichever comes first)
Extended warranty options are available from £118 per year
SEAT approved accessories carry a minimum 2-year warranty
UK and European roadside assistance is included with servicing
The Leon ST was the fastest-selling used car in the UK market according to Auto Trader
The Leon has been a benchmark in technology, design, and equipment in the compact car segment
Production takes place at SEAT's facility in Martorell, Spain
The Leon nameplate has sold millions of units across four generations
The fourth generation Leon was launched in 2020
Multiple color options are available including metallic and special paint finishes
The FR trim features sporty exterior styling with unique bumpers and side skirts
Dark tinted windows are standard on FR Sport trim
The vehicle features a shark fin antenna
Roof rails are available for increased carrying capacity
The Leon ST offers a good balance between sportiness, practicality, and efficiency for family use
